member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.AbstractRange
member.summary: Base class for classes representing one or more excel cells.
member.seealso: Referencing ExcelCell and CellRange in C# and VB.NET

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.AbstractRange.#ctor(GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelWorksheet)
member.summary: Internal.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.AbstractRange.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of instance.
member.remarks: A cell name includes its column letter and row number. For example, the name of a cell in row 0 and column 0 is "A1". A cell range name includes the column letter and row number of first (top-left) and last (bottom-right) cell. For example, the name of range [0, 0]...[4, 4] is "A1:E5", of range [0, 0]...[4, MaxColumns-1] is "1:5", of range [0, 0]...[MaxRows-1, 4] is "A:E", of single cell range [4, 4]...[4, 4] is "E5".

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.AbstractRange.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell formatting of one or more cells.
member.value: The cell formatting of one or more cells.

remarks.para: Conceptually, cell formatting is divided into following groups:

item.description: Number - indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell. Associated property is .
Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

remarks.para: Additional properties not associated with any formatting group are:

item.description: - name of the referenced workbook style.
- to store numeric value of a cell as text; otherwise, .
- if referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Workbook contains a set of master styles which can be referenced by multiple cells.
Workbook must always contain at least one master style which cannot be removed and is, by default, referenced by all cells. This default style is .
Workbook style can either be built-in or user-defined. Built-in style is accessible from workbook styles via enumeration.

Cell formatting group (Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill or Protection) (and its associated properties) is resolved from referenced workbook (master) style, unless cell formatting group or its associated property is modified.

Cell formatting is available for one or more cells through property which is available on and types. Cell formatting specified on and types through property is simply propagated to cell formatting of its .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CalculationEngine.CalculationOptions
member.summary: Class represents various calculation engine options.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CalculationEngine.CalculationOptions.EnableIterativeCalculation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether iterative calculation is enabled.
member.value: True if iterative calculation is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CalculationEngine.CalculationOptions.MaximumIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum calculation iterations.
member.value: The maximum calculation iterations.
member.remarks: This property defines the maximum number of formula recalculations for a circular reference.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CalculationEngine.CalculationOptions.MaximumChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum calculation change.
member.value: The maximum calculation change.
member.remarks: This property defines the maximum value change in circular reference iterations after which the calculation process is stopped.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CalculationEngine.CalculationOptions.EnableCaching
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the intermediate results of formulas should be cached. For some files, caching can decrease the time necessary to calculate formulas.
member.value: The value indicates whether the intermediate results of formulas should be cached. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use this property with caution, however. For most files, caching will not improve performance, but hurt it. Caching is useful only when there are repeated formulas (or expressions) that are always evaluated to the same result. So, even though some formulas can look the same, their results will be different; Thus, they are inapplicable for caching. An example of such a formula is =MAX(ROW(), COLUMN()), whose result will not be cached, because the result depends on the cell where the formula is placed.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CalculationEngine.CalculationOptions.PrioritizeR1C1ReferencingNotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to prioritize R1C1 notation over A1 notation when evaluating formulas.
member.value: The value indicating whether to prioritize R1C1 notation over A1 notation when evaluating formulas. The default value is false (A1 notation is prioritized).
member.remarks: This property is necessary because some references can be ambiguous. For example "RC1" references the RC column and first row in A1 notation and the current row and first column in R1C1 notation.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellBorder
member.summary: Represents the color and line style for the single border of a cell.

remarks.para: Diagonal-up ( / ) and diagonal-down ( / ) always share the same color and line style.
Conceptually, cell formatting is divided into following groups:

item.description: Number - indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell. Associated property is .
Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

remarks.para: Additional properties not associated with any formatting group are:

item.description: - name of the referenced workbook style.
- to store numeric value of a cell as text; otherwise, .
- if referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Workbook contains a set of master styles which can be referenced by multiple cells.
Workbook must always contain at least one master style which cannot be removed and is, by default, referenced by all cells. This default style is .
Workbook style can either be built-in or user-defined. Built-in style is accessible from workbook styles via enumeration.

Cell formatting group (Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill or Protection) (and its associated properties) is resolved from referenced workbook (master) style, unless cell formatting group or its associated property is modified.

Cell formatting is available for one or more cells through property which is available on and types. Cell formatting specified on and types through property is simply propagated to cell formatting of its .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellBorder.LineColor

Default value is color created from name .

Cell formatting group (Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill or Protection) (and its associated properties) is resolved from referenced workbook (master) style, unless cell formatting group or its associated property is modified.

Cell formatting is available for one or more cells through property which is available on and types. Cell formatting specified on and types through property is simply propagated to cell formatting of its .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.

Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellRange
member.summary: Cell range is a rectangular group of worksheet cells.

remarks.para: Cell range is determined by its top, left, bottom and right borders. These properties are read-only, so if you require different cell range use one of the following methods: , , or . Specific cell can be accessed in a few ways, depending on . Cells in the range can be merged / unmerged by the use of property.
property set will set value of multiple cells or of a merged range. property get has meaning only if range is merged; otherwise, exception is thrown.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Merged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells in this range are merged.

remarks.para: By setting this property to , you are merging all the cells () in this range. Merging process will fail if any of the cells in the range is already merged.

When modifying merged cell, whole merged range is modified. For example, if you set ExcelCell.Value, value of merged range will be modified. You can find out if the cell is merged by checking if ExcelCell.MergedRange property is different than .

member.exception: Merged range can't be created because some of the cells in the range are already merged.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellRange.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets formula string.

remarks.para: Old XLS format requires all formulas to be parsed and saved to XLS files as special tokens in RPN (Reverse Polish notation). GemBox.Spreadsheet only knows how to parse limited set of formulas listed below.
New XLSX (Open XML) format stores formulas as strings and leaves formula parsing to applications that read XLSX documents. Therefore, ALL formulas are supported when writing/reading XLSX files.
Depending on ExcelFile.DelayFormulaParse property, formula string can be parsed when this property is set or when one of ExcelFile.SaveXls methods is called.
GemBox.Spreadsheet formula parser will use English culture to parse numbers.

Currently unsupported formula features are:
Array formula
R1C1 reference

Currently supported functions in XLS format are: ABS, ACOS, ACOSH, ADDRESS, AND, ARCTAN, AREAS, ASC, ASIN, ASINH, ATAN2, ATANH, AVEDEV, AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, BETADIST, BETAINV, BINOMDIST, CEILING, CELL, CHAR, CHIDST, CHIINV, CHOOSE, CLEAN, CODE, COLUMN, COLUMNS, COMBIN, CONCATENATE, CONFIDENCE, COS, COSH, COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTBLANK, COUNTIF, CRITBINOM, DATE, DATEDIF, DATESTRING, DATEVALUE, DAVERAGE, DAY, DAYS360, DB, DBSC, DCOUNT, DCOUNTA, DDB, DEGREES, DEVSQ, DGET, DMAX, DMIN, DOLLAR, DPRODUCT, DSTDEV, DSTDEVP, DSUM, DVAR, DVARP, EVEN, EXACT, EXP, EXPONDIST, FACT, FDIST, FIND, FINDB, FINV, FISHER, FISHERINV, FIXED, FLOOR, FV, GAMMADIST, GAMMAINV, GAMMALN, GEOMEAN, GROWTH, HARMEAN, HLOOKUP, HOUR, HYPERLINK, HYPGEOMVERT, IF, INDEX, INDIRECT, INFO, INT, IPMT, IRR, ISBLANK, ISERR, ISERROR, ISLOGICAL, ISNA, ISNONTEXT, ISNUMBER, ISPMT, ISREF, ISTEXT, KURT, LARGE, LEFT, LEFTB, LEN, LENB, LINEST, LN, LOG, LOG10, LOGEST, LOGINV, LOOKUP, LOWER, MATCH, MAX, MAXA, MDETERM, MEDIAN, MID, MIDB, MIN, MINA, MINUTE, MINVERSE, MIRR, MNORMSINV, MOD, MODE, MONTH, N, NA, EGBINOMDIST, NORMDIST, NORMINV, NORMSDIST, NORMSDIST, NOT, NOW, NPER, NPV, NUMBERSTRING, ODD, OFFSET, OR, PERCENTILE, PERCENTRANK, PERMUT, PHONETIC, PI, PMT, POISSON, POWER, PPMT, PRODUCT, PROPER, PV, QUARTILE, RADIANS, RAND, RANK, RATE, REPLACE, REPLACEB, REPT, RIGHT, RIGHTB, ROMAN, ROUND, ROUNDDOWN, ROUNDUP, ROW, ROWS, SEARCH, SEARCHB, SECOND, SIGN, SIN, SINH, SKEW, SLN, SMALL, SQRT, STANDARDIZE, STDEV, STDEVA, STDEVP, STDEVPA, SUBSTITUTE, SUBTOTAL, SUM, SUMIF, SUMSQ, SYD, T, TAN, TANH, TDIST, TEXT, TIME, TIMEVALUE, TINV, TODAY, TRANSPOSE, TREND, TRIM, TRIMMEAN, TRUNC, TYPE, UPPER, USDOLLAR, VALUE, VAR, VARA, VARP, VARPA, VDB, VLOOKUP, WEEKDAY, WEIBULL, YEAR, ZTEST, FALSE, TRUE.
For more information on formulas, consult Microsoft Excel documentation.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle
member.summary: Represents cell formatting.

remarks.para: Conceptually, cell formatting is divided into following groups:

item.description: Number - indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell. Associated property is .
Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

remarks.para: Additional properties not associated with any formatting group are:

item.description: - name of the referenced workbook style.
- to store numeric value of a cell as text; otherwise, .
- if referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Workbook contains a set of master styles which can be referenced by multiple cells.
Workbook must always contain at least one master style which cannot be removed and is, by default, referenced by all cells. This default style is .
Workbook style can either be built-in or user-defined. Built-in style is accessible from workbook styles via enumeration.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.CellStyle.NumberFormat

summary.para: Gets or sets the number format which indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell.
Default value is General.
If set to , number format will be resolved from referenced workbook style.

remarks.para: If the value of this property is General or and is of type, ISO date/time format will be used as number format.
Custom number format has to be in invariant culture format.
Example:
For more information on number format strings consult Microsoft Excel documentation.

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Charts.ChartAxis.NumberFormatLinkedToSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format axis value labels.
member.value: if number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format axis value labels; otherwise, .

remarks.para: If is , then number format from chart's source data (cells) will be used to format axis value labels based on the following logic:

remarks.para: Setting the value also changes position of the axis perpendicular to this one. summary.para: Chart series are drawn next to each other on the value axis.

This value is currently supported only by and when exporting a chart to PDF, XPS or image file formats. This value is exported as for all other chart types.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution
member.summary: Defines resolution method that determines DataTable column type.
member.remarks: DataTable column type is determined by the column type resolution and by exploring types of all in some column. Column type can be , , , DateTime, or .

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution.Object
member.summary: All columns will be of type .

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution.StringInvariantCulture
member.summary: All columns will be of type . For conversion from some to string invariant culture will be used.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution.StringCurrentCulture
member.summary: All columns will be of type . For conversion from some to string current culture will be used.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution.Auto
member.summary: If all values in some column have the same type then that type will be used for DataTable column type, otherwise column will be of type .

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution.AutoPreferStringInvariantCulture
member.summary: If all values in some column have the same type then that type will be used for DataTable column type, otherwise column will be of type . For conversion from some to string invariant culture will be used.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ColumnTypeResolution.AutoPreferStringCurrentCulture
member.summary: If all values in some column have the same type then that type will be used for DataTable column type, otherwise column will be of type . For conversion from some to string current culture will be used.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ComHelper
member.summary: Contains methods that can be useful for users which are calling GemBox.Spreadsheet component using COM interop.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ComHelper.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ComHelper.ComSetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method from your application to set GemBox.Spreadsheet serial key.

remarks.para: You should call this method before using any other class from GemBox.Spreadsheet library. Key can only be set once (if you try second key, exception will be thrown). The best place to call this method is from static constructor of your application's main class.
Valid serial key has multiple groups of alphanumeric characters, separated with dashes.
Free version serial key is: FREE-LIMITED-KEY.

member.param: Serial key.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ComHelper.IsEncrypted(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the file is an encrypted XLSX.
member.param: The path from which to read a file.
member.returns: if file is an encrypted XLSX; otherwise, .

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ComHelper.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a spreadsheet from a file with the specified path.
member.param: The path from which to load a spreadsheet.
member.returns: A loaded spreadsheet.
member.remarks:
File extension that is extracted from the is used to create the appropriate derived class instance that is then passed to the method.
Following file extensions are supported:
Microsoft Excel: .xlsx, xlsm, .xltx, .xltm, .xls, .xlt
OpenDocument Spreadsheet: .ods, .ots
Character Separated Values: .csv, .tsv
HyperText Markup Language: .htm, .html, .mht, .mhtml
member.seealso: Open and read Excel file in C# and VB.NET
Convert Excel files to PDF in C# and VB.NET

member.value: if empty entries are OK and do not violate the validation constraints; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DataValidation.InCellDropdown
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the dropdown combo box for a data validation type.
member.value: to display the dropdown combo box for a data validation type; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DataValidation.Formula1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.value: The first formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.remarks:
It used as a bounds for and relational operators, and the only formula used for other relational operators (, , , , , ), or for or data validation type. The content can be an instance of any type, but the following rules apply when formula is being written:
If data validation type is or , and content is integral data type (, , , , , , , ), formula will be saved as integral constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is floating-point data type (, , ), formula will be saved as floating-point constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is data type, formula will be saved as date constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is data type, formula will be saved as time constant, else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and content is any type that implements , formula will be saved as list series (comma separated values), else if formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , and formula is an Excel formula or an Excel reference ( that starts with '='), value will be saved as a formula, otherwise, it will be saved as string constant.
If data validation type is , formula won't be saved.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DataValidation.Formula2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.value: The second formula in the DataValidation dropdown.
member.remarks: It used as a bounds for and relational operators only. For the information about the content, see remarks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the file path to the X.509 certificate.
member.value: The file path to the X.509 certificate.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether private keys are stored in the local computer store rather than the current user store.
member.value: if private keys are stored in the local computer store rather than the current user store; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DigitalSignatureSaveOptions.CertificatePassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the password required to access the X.509 certificate data.
member.value: The password required to access the X.509 certificate data.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DigitalSignatureSaveOptions.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the CPU host name or physical location of the signing.
member.value: The CPU host name or physical location of the signing.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DigitalSignatureSaveOptions.Reason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason for the signing.
member.value: The reason for the signing, such as ( I agree … ).

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DigitalSignatureSaveOptions.ContactInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact information.
member.value: Information provided by the signer to enable a recipient to contact the signer to verify the signature; for example, a phone number.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.DigitalSignatureSaveOptions.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets the signature.
member.value: The signature.

remarks.para: If value is , then digital signature won't have any visual representation.
Signature is not drawn in the same layer as the rest of the page, but in a layer above the page. Signature's position is specified through .

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.Content.Open

summary.para: Opens the content as a .
Make sure to call on the returned instance after it is no longer used and before it gets out of scope.

member.returns: An instance of a type that represents content data.
member.remarks: If content is linked to the workbook file ( property is not ), this method will attempt to open an external content. This operation might fail if the value is not in the correct format or if executing code doesn't have permissions to access content at the location specified in the value.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.System3DDark
member.summary: System '3D Dark' color. Specifies a Dark shadow color for three-dimensional display elements. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x696969, RGB = (105, 105, 105), HSL = (0, 0, 105).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.System3DLight
member.summary: System '3D Light' color. Specifies a Light color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source). Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xE3E3E3, RGB = (227, 227, 227), HSL = (0, 0, 227).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemActiveBorder
member.summary: System 'Active Border' color. Specifies an Active Window Border Color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xB4B4B4, RGB = (180, 180, 180), HSL = (0, 0, 180).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemActiveCaption
member.summary: System 'Active Caption' color. Specifies the active window title bar color. In particular the left side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar if the gradient effect is enabled. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x99B4D1, RGB = (153, 180, 209), HSL = (150, 96, 181).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemApplicationWorkspace
member.summary: System 'Application Workspace' color. Specifies the Background color of multiple document interface (MDI) applications. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xABABAB, RGB = (171, 171, 171), HSL = (0, 0, 171).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemBackground
member.summary: System 'Background' color. Specifies the desktop background color. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemButtonFace
member.summary: System 'Button Face' color. Specifies the face color for three-dimensional display elements and for dialog box backgrounds. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xF0F0F0, RGB = (240, 240, 240), HSL = (0, 0, 240).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemButtonHighlight
member.summary: System 'Button Highlight' color. Specifies the highlight color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing the light source). Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xFFFFFF, RGB = (255, 255, 255), HSL = (0, 0, 255).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemButtonShadow
member.summary: System 'Button Shadow' color. Specifies the shadow color for three-dimensional display elements (for edges facing away from the light source). Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xA0A0A0, RGB = (160, 160, 160), HSL = (0, 0, 160).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemButtonText
member.summary: System 'Button Text' color. Specifies the color of text on push buttons. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemCaptionText
member.summary: System 'Caption Text' color. Specifies the color of text in the caption, size box, and scroll bar arrow box. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x000000, RGB = (0, 0, 0), HSL = (0, 0, 0).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemGradientActiveCaption
member.summary: System 'Gradient Active Caption' color. Specifies the right side color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xB9D1EA, RGB = (185, 209, 234), HSL = (149, 137, 210).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemGradientInactiveCaption

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemGrayText

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemHighlight
member.summary: System 'Highlight' color. Specifies the color of Item(s) selected in a control. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0x3399FF, RGB = (51, 153, 255), HSL = (149, 255, 153).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemHighlightText
member.summary: System 'Highlight Text' color. Specifies the text color of item(s) selected in a control. Default Windows system values: RGB = 0xFFFFFF, RGB = (255, 255, 255), HSL = (0, 0, 255).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemHotLight

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.DrawingColorName.SystemInactiveBorder

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.FillFormatType
member.summary: Represents the fill type that can be applied to various objects, such as shapes, text characters, table cells and their outlines, borders and underlines.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.FillFormatType.None
member.summary: No fill. The shape is not filled, thus making its interior transparent.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.FillFormatType.Solid
member.summary: Solid color fill. The shape is filled entirely with the specified color.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.FillFormatType.Gradient
member.summary: Gradient fill. The shape is filled with the smooth gradual transition of colors at the specified locations that either follows a line or a path.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.FillFormatType.Picture
member.summary: Picture fill. The shape is filled with the picture that can either be tiled (as a texture) or stretched to fill the available area. This fill type is not supported for outlines, borders and underlines.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.FillFormatType.Pattern
member.summary: Pattern fill. The shape is filled with the repeated pattern of the specified foreground and background color.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.Length
member.summary: Represents a length, distance or a coordinate.

remarks.para: internally stores its value in an field and internally uses EMU (English Metric Unit) as a unit of measurement.

EMU (English Metric Unit) can evenly divide in both English and Metric units and can avoid rounding errors during the calculation since it defines an integer based, high precision coordinate system (1" = 914 400 EMU, 1 cm = 360 000 EMU, 1 mm = 36 000 EMU, 1 pt = 12 700 EMU).

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.Length.DefaultUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the default measurement unit that is applied globally every time is converted from/to a and to a .
member.value: The default measurement unit.

remarks.para: Initial value is .
This property makes code less verbose and, thus, easier to read and maintain because instead of using , and methods, one can use implicit conversions from/to a and to a .

Since default measurement unit is applied globally (like any other member), it is advisable not to set property or use implicit conversions from/to a and to a if GemBox.Spreadsheet is used by various application functions that expect different default measurement unit, especially if usage is multi-threaded.

1 - line segment of the same length as the line width, 0 - space of the same length as the line width.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat
member.summary: Represents an outline style that can be applied to a number of different objects such as shapes and text. The line allows for the specifying of many different types of outlines including even line dashes and bevels.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.Fill

summary.para: Gets or sets the fill of the outline.
Fill types , and are currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The fill of the outline.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.Width

summary.para: Gets or sets the width to be used for the underline stroke.
Default value is 0.

member.value: The width to be used for the underline stroke.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.CapType

summary.para: Gets or sets the ending caps that should be used for this line. This also affects the ends of line segments for dashed lines.
Default value is .

member.value: The ending caps that should be used for this line.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.CompoundType

summary.para: Gets or sets the compound line type to be used for the underline stroke.
Default value is .
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The compound line type to be used for the underline stroke.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.DashType

summary.para: Gets or sets the dashing scheme that should be used for this line.
Default value is (no dashes).

member.value: The dashing scheme that should be used for this line.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.JoinType

summary.para: Gets or sets the line join type that indicates how connected lines are joined.
Default value is .

member.value: The line join type that indicates how connected lines are joined.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.BeginArrow

summary.para: Gets or sets the decorations added to the head of a line.
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The decorations added to the head of a line.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only on shape paths that are not closed.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.LineFormat.EndArrow

summary.para: Gets or sets the decorations added to the tail of a line.
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The decorations added to the tail of a line.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only on shape paths that are not closed.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextBoxFormat.Centered

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the centering of the text box.

The way it works fundamentally is to determine the smallest possible "bounds box" for the text and then to center that "bounds box" accordingly. This is different than , which aligns the text within the "bounds box" for the text.
This property is compatible with all of the different kinds of .
Default value is .
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: if the text box is horizontally centered; otherwise, .

member.value: The text direction.

summary.para: Gets or sets the text auto-fitting setting.
Default value is .

member.value: The text auto-fitting setting.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextBoxFormat.AutoFitShrinkTextFontScale

summary.para: Gets or sets the percentage of the original font size to which each in the is scaled when is .
Default value is 1 if is ; otherwise, .

member.value: The percentage of the original font size to which each in the is scaled when is .
member.exception: Property can be set only if property is .
Value is not between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: In order to auto-fit text within a bounding box it is sometimes necessary to decrease the font size by a certain percentage. Using this property the font within a text box can be scaled based on the value provided. A value of 1 scales the text to 100%, while a value of 0.01 scales the text to 1%.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextBoxFormat.AutoFitShrinkTextLineSpaceReduction

summary.para: Gets or sets the percentage amount by which the line spacing of each in the is reduced when is .
This property applies only to paragraphs with percentage line spacing.
Default value is 0 if is ; otherwise, .

member.value: The percentage amount by which the line spacing of each in the is reduced when is .
member.exception: Property can be set only if property is .
Value is not between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: The reduction is applied by subtracting it from the original line spacing value. Using this property the vertical spacing between the lines of text can be scaled by a percent amount. A value of 1 reduces the line spacing by 100%, while a value of 0.01 reduces the line spacing by one percent.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to wrap text in shape.

member.value: if words are wrapped within the bounding rectangle; otherwise, if words spill out without paying attention to the bounding rectangle boundaries.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextBoxFormat.ColumnNumber

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of columns of text in the bounding rectangle.
Default value is 1.
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The number of columns of text in the bounding rectangle.
member.exception: Value is less than 1.
member.remarks: When applied to a this property takes the width of the bounding box for the text and divides it by the number of columns specified. These columns are then treated as overflow containers in that when the previous column has been filled with text the next column acts as the repository for additional text. When all columns have been filled and text still remains then the overflow properties set for this are used and the text is reflowed to make room for additional text.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextBoxFormat.ColumnSpacing

summary.para: Gets or sets the space between text columns when there is more than 1 column present in the .
Default value is 0.
This member is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats.

member.value: The space between text columns when there is more than 1 column present in the .
member.exception: Value is less than zero.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextDirection
member.summary: Represents an enumeration of available text directions.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextDirection.Horizontal
member.summary: Horizontal text.

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextDirection.Rotate90
member.summary: Text is vertical orientation (each line is 90 degrees rotated clockwise, so it goes from top to bottom; each next line is to the left from the previous one).

member.name: F:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextDirection.Rotate270
member.summary: Text is vertical orientation (each line is 270 degrees rotated clockwise, so it goes from bottom to top; each next line is to the right from the previous one).

summary.para: Text is vertical (one letter on top of another).
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.
Text is vertical (one letter on top of another) as for but should be shown from right to left rather than left to right.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.
A special version of , where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.

A special version of , where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical. The difference between this and the is the text flows top down then LEFT RIGHT, instead of RIGHT LEFT.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextFormat.Offset

summary.para: Gets or sets the offset for both the superscript and subscript fonts. Positive value indicates superscript and negative value indicates subscript. The size is specified using a percentage where 0.01 is equal to 1 percent of the font size and 1 is equal to 100 percent font of the font size.
Default value is 0.

This member is currently partially supported in PDF, XPS and image formats. All positive values are exported in the same superscript position and all negative values are exported in the same subscript position.

member.value: The offset for both the superscript and subscript fonts.
member.exception: Value is not between -1 and 1 (inclusive).

summary.para: Gets or sets the numbering scheme of the numbered list.
Default value is .
This allows specifying formats other than strictly numbers. For instance, a set of bullets can be represented by a series of Roman numerals instead of the standard 1,2,3, etc. number set.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.Drawing.TextListFormat.NumberStartAt

summary.para: Gets or sets the number that starts a given sequence of a numbered list.
Default value is 1 if is ; otherwise, -1.

When the numbering is alphabetical, the number should map to the appropriate letter. For instance 1 maps to 'a', 2 to 'b' and so on. If the numbers are larger than 26, then multiple letters should be used. For instance 27 should be represented as 'aa' and similarly 53 should be 'aaa'.

member.value: The number that starts a given sequence of a numbered list.
member.exception: Value is not between 1 and 32767 (inclusive).

remarks.para: This property always returns a new instance of a that points to data associated with this paragraph. This reduces memory footprint since simpler internal structures can be used to hold the data and execution time increase is negligible since Garbage Collector has a very good performance for a short-lived (Generation 0) objects.

When setting a value, instance of a won't actually be stored in this paragraph, but the data to which the instance points to will be copied. This enables easy copying of complex properties from one text element to another.

member.summary: Align the text to the top of the bounding rectangle.

summary.para: Anchor the text so that it is justified vertically.
When text is horizontal, this spaces out the actual lines of text and is almost always identical in behavior to (special case: if only 1 line, then aligned to ).
When text is vertical, then it justifies the letters vertically. This is different than , because in some cases such as very little text in a line, it does not justify.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.
Align the text so that it is distributed vertically.
When text is horizontal, this spaces out the actual lines of text and is almost always identical in behavior to (special case: if only 1 line, then aligned to ).
When text is vertical, then it distributes the letters vertically. This is different than , because it always forces distribution of the words, even if there are only one or two words in a line.
This value is currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image formats and value is exported instead.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell
member.summary: Excel cell provides access to a single worksheet cell or to a merged range if the cell is merged.

remarks.para: Merged range is created by using CellRange.Merged property. See the property documentation for more information on merging.

member.seealso: CellRange.Merged
Referencing ExcelCell and CellRange in C# and VB.NET

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Worksheet
member.summary: Gets the parent worksheet.

member.summary: Gets row of the cell.

member.summary: Gets column of the cell.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets value of this cell or of merged range if this cell is merged.

remarks.para: Exception is thrown if value for the set is not of supported type (See ExcelFile.SupportsType for details).

Note that the fact some type is supported doesn't mean it is written to Excel file in the native format. As Microsoft Excel has just few basic types, the object of supported type will be converted to a similar excel type. If similar excel type doesn't exist, value is written as a string value.
If the value of this property is of type and number format is not set, ISO date/time format will be used as CellStyle.NumberFormat value.

member.exception: Value is not supported.
member.seealso: CellRange.Merged
ExcelFile.SupportsType
CellStyle.NumberFormat

remarks.para: You can set comment text, set whether comment will be visible when opening xlsx file or not. Additionally you can get column or row of the excel cell to which this comment is assigned.
Supported only in xlsx.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Hyperlink
member.summary: Gets or sets cell hyperlink.

remarks.para: Supported only in xlsx. If you want hyperlinks also to work in XLS, assign HYPERLINK formula to ExcelCell.Formula.
You can set cell style to underline and font color to blue in order to appear as hyperlink, that is not done automatically.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets cell formula string.

remarks.para: Old XLS format requires all formulas to be parsed and saved to XLS files as special tokens in RPN (Reverse Polish notation). GemBox.Spreadsheet only knows how to parse limited set of formulas.
New XLSX (Open XML) format stores formulas as strings and leaves formula parsing to applications that read XLSX documents. Therefore, ALL formulas are supported when writing/reading XLSX files.
Depending on ExcelFile.DelayFormulaParse property, formula string can be parsed when this property is set or when one of ExcelFile.SaveXls methods is called.
GemBox.Spreadsheet formula parser will use English culture to parse numbers.
Currently unsupported formula features are:

item.description: Array formula

remarks.para: For more information on formulas, consult Microsoft Excel documentation.

member.seealso: NamedRangeCollection.Add

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.Calculate
member.summary: Calculates formula for this excel cell.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.ConvertExcelNumberToDateTime(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts Excel floating-point number to structure.

remarks.para: Excel file format doesn't have a separate data type for date and time. value is stored as IEEE number encoded in a special way. When reading Excel file, CellStyle.NumberFormat is examined and if it matches some of date/time number formats cell value is interpreted as .

However, if some non-standard date/time number format is used, cell value will not be recognized as but as ordinary number. In such cases (when you know that specific cell holds value but you get a number when reading Excel file) use this method to convert IEEE number to structure.

member.param: Excel floating-point number.
True to use 1904 date system.
member.returns: Converted DateTime structure.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelCell.ConvertDateTimeToExcelNumber(System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts structure to Excel floating-point number.
member.param: DateTime structure.
True to use 1904 date system.
member.returns: Converted Excel floating-point number.

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn
member.summary: Excel column contains column options and cell range with column cells.

remarks.para: Note that the cells are internally allocated in rows and not in columns. ExcelColumn objects are created only if they have non-standard width or style, or they are accessed directly. So, while ExcelRowCollection.Count shows number of rows occupied with data, ExcelColumnCollection.Count does not say which Column is the last one occupied with data!
If you want to read all data in a sheet, use ExcelRow.AllocatedCells property.
If you want to find last column occupied with data, use method.

member.seealso: Referencing ExcelCell and CellRange in C# and VB.NET

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets column width.
member.remarks: Unit is 1/256th of the width of the zero character in default font.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn.AutoFit
member.summary: Automatically fits column width to the minimum size required for all data in the column to be visible.

remarks.para: Auto-fit column width is a MS Excel feature and not a file format feature. Autofit method uses methods from System.Drawing to determine the real data width.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumn.AutoFit(System.Double)
member.summary: Automatically fits column width to the minimum size required for all data in the column to be visible.

remarks.para: Auto-fit column width is a MS Excel feature and not a file format feature. Autofit method uses methods from System.Drawing to determine the real data width.
Scaling factor is used to adjust the width of the column. Resulting column width is equal to CalculatedWidth * scaling. Default scaling is 1.

member.param: Scaling factor.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumnRowBase.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell formatting of cells in this column / row.
member.value: The cell formatting of cells in this column / row.

remarks.para: Conceptually, cell formatting is divided into following groups:

item.description: Number - indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell. Associated property is .
Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

remarks.para: Additional properties not associated with any formatting group are:

item.description: - name of the referenced workbook style.
- to store numeric value of a cell as text; otherwise, .
- if referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Workbook contains a set of master styles which can be referenced by multiple cells.
Workbook must always contain at least one master style which cannot be removed and is, by default, referenced by all cells. This default style is .
Workbook style can either be built-in or user-defined. Built-in style is accessible from workbook styles via enumeration.

Cell formatting group (Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill or Protection) (and its associated properties) is resolved from referenced workbook (master) style, unless cell formatting group or its associated property is modified.

Cell formatting is available for one or more cells through property which is available on and types. Cell formatting specified on and types through property is simply propagated to cell formatting of its .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumnRowBase.Collapsed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether object is collapsed in outlining.

remarks.para: When you use outline grouping and you want outline group to be collapsed, you need to set three properties:
property needs to be set to correct outline level.
If group is collapsed, for all rows in the collapsed group property needs to be set to .
If group is collapsed, for the row where collapsed (plus) sign is located property needs to be set to .
This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumnRowBase.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets outline level.

remarks.para: Exception is thrown if value is out of 0 to 7 range.

Using this property you can create hierarchical groups. Range of consecutive objects (rows or columns) with the same value of outline level belongs to the same group. Default value is zero, which prevents grouping.
When you use outline grouping and you want outline group to be collapsed, you need to set three properties:
property needs to be set to correct outline level.
If group is collapsed, for all rows in the collapsed group property needs to be set to .
If group is collapsed, for the row where collapsed (plus) sign is located property needs to be set to .
This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.

member.exception: Value is out of 0 to 7 range.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelColumnRowBase.Hidden
member.summary: Gets or sets whether excel object is hidden.

remarks.para: When you use outline grouping and you want outline group to be collapsed, you need to set three properties:
property needs to be set to correct outline level.
If group is collapsed, for all rows in the collapsed group property needs to be set to .
If group is collapsed, for the row where collapsed (plus) sign is located property needs to be set to .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.GroupMethodsAffectedCellsLimit
member.summary: Maximum number of affected cells in group set methods.
member.remarks: If user tries to modify all cells in a group which has more cells than specified limit, exception will be thrown. This property was introduced to prevent users from accidentally modifying millions of cells which results in a long delay, a large memory allocation and a big resulting file. You can set this limit to value which suits your needs (minimum is 5).

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.Use1904DateSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether 1904 date system is used.
member.remarks: Default value for this property is . For more information on 1904 date system, consult Microsoft Excel documentation.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.DelayFormulaParse
member.summary: Delays formula parsing until one of SaveXls methods is called.

remarks.para: Old XLS format requires all formulas to be parsed and saved to XLS files as special tokens in RPN (Reverse Polish notation). GemBox.Spreadsheet only knows how to parse limited set of formulas listed at ExcelCell.Formula page. Only listed formulas can be saved to XLS file.
New XLSX (Open XML) format stores formulas as strings and leaves formula parsing to applications that read XLSX documents. Therefore, ALL formulas are supported when writing/reading XLSX files.

If this property is true, each set of ExcelCell.Formula property will just store formula string. When one of ExcelFile.SaveXls methods is called formulas are parsed and exception is thrown if formula is not supported or in bad format. When XLSX is saved, formulas are not parsed, they are just saved as strings. If the formula is in bad format, MS Excel or other application will report an error in formula.

If this property is false, formula string is parsed every time you set ExcelCell.Formula property. You will limit formulas to the ones supported by GemBox.Spreadsheet parser and the exception will be thrown immediately if the formula is not supported or in bad format.
Default value of this property is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.PivotCaches

summary.para: Gets the collection of s defined in this instance.
Currently supported in XLSX only.

member.value: The collection of s defined in this instance.

remarks.para: Pivot Tables are used to arrange and aggregate complicated data and drill down on details.
Source of data for Pivot Table can be:

item.description: Worksheet - cell range, named range, table, etc.
External - database, OLAP cube, textual file, web query, etc.
Other - multiple consolidation ranges in the workbook, another Pivot Table, etc.

note.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet currently supports creating only worksheet source.
All other sources are supported through preservation (to correctly round-trip to XLSX format).

remarks.para: Source of the data for Pivot Table contains following information:

item.description: Scheme - data source fields/columns, its data types, etc.
Data - actual data source records.

remarks.para: Pivot Table does not directly reference its data source, but instead it references a cache of a data source. Cache of a data source contains an in-memory copy of data source scheme and, optionally, data and is stored in a workbook which may contain multiple caches of various sources of data.

Cache can be updated/refreshed from a data source automatically (for example, when opening a workbook) or on request. Cache is used to provide better performance of Pivot Table functionality which requires frequent access to data records and their values and to enable sharing the same data source between multiple Pivot Tables.

GemBox.Spreadsheet represents cache with a type. Cache source is represented with a type (and its sub-types) and can be accessed from a property. instances are stored in a collection. currently doesn't store the actual cached records (it stores only scheme - fields and their properties), but instead Microsoft Excel is instructed to update the record cache from the data source when opening a workbook.

is created from a with the specified name and the specified cell in the worksheet where it is placed using the method. contains the collection which elements can be moved into the following Pivot Table areas:

item.description: Report Filter Area represented by collection.
Row Axis represented by collection.
Column Axis represented by collection.
Values Area represented by collection.

remarks.para: Each (non-calculated) can contain zero or more s which are used for filtering and grouping by a specific value.

Except using fields defined in Pivot Table data source (more precisely, in ) which cannot be removed, Pivot Table can also define calculated s and calculated s which use a formula to specify their values. Calculated can be added using a method and removed using a method. Property tells if a field is calculated or is a field from the data source. Calculated is automatically moved to a Values Area ( collection) and only Values Area can contain calculated s. Calculated can be added using a method and removed using a method. Property tells if an item is calculated.

note.para: If calculated is added/removed in one , then it is also added/removed from all other s which reference the same .
Since adding/removing calculated s means changing the data scheme, which is defined in , actual modification is made in and propagated to all s which are referencing it.

remarks.para: s can be re-ordered in a specific area using the method. s can be re-ordered using the method.

note.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet currently does not provide functionality to read/calculate the actual data from the .
It provides the functionality to arrange and customize s, s and appearance.

Because of that data is not rendered/written to other output formats like PDF, HTML, etc. When output XLSX file with Pivot Table is opened in Microsoft Excel application, its data is automatically retrieved and calculated from the data source by Microsoft Excel.

member.seealso: Create Excel Pivot Tables in C# and VB.NET

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.Styles
member.summary: Gets the collection of workbook (master) s defined for this instance.

remarks.para: Conceptually, cell formatting is divided into following groups:

item.description: Number - indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell. Associated property is .
Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

remarks.para: Additional properties not associated with any formatting group are:

item.description: - name of the referenced workbook style.
- to store numeric value of a cell as text; otherwise, .
- if referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Workbook contains a set of master styles which can be referenced by multiple cells.
Workbook must always contain at least one master style which cannot be removed and is, by default, referenced by all cells. This default style is .
Workbook style can either be built-in or user-defined. Built-in style is accessible from workbook styles via enumeration.

Cell formatting group (Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill or Protection) (and its associated properties) is resolved from referenced workbook (master) style, unless cell formatting group or its associated property is modified.

Cell formatting is available for one or more cells through property which is available on and types. Cell formatting specified on and types through property is simply propagated to cell formatting of its .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.AutoDetectCsvSeparator(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Autodetects CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input stream returns (char)0.
member.remarks: This method counts the number of occurrences of the most common separators (',', ';', '\t') and returns one that has occurred the most times in first 5 rows.
member.param: Input Stream.
member.returns: Char that is CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input StreamReader returns (char)0, and if there are two with equal number of occurrence, returns first of them.

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.AutoDetectCsvSeparator(System.IO.StreamReader,System.Int32,System.Char[])
member.summary: Autodetects CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input stream returns (char)0.
member.remarks: This method counts the number of occurrences of chars that are specified in the array possibleSeparators, and returns one that has occurred the most times in first rowsToTest rows of StreamReader sr.
member.param: Input StreamReader.
Number of rows to test.
Chars that can be CSV separators.
member.returns: Char that is CSV separator. If there's no separators in the input StreamReader returns (char)0, and if there are two with equal number of occurrence, returns first of them.

Microsoft Excel: .xlsx, xlsm, .xltx, .xltm, .xls, .xlt
OpenDocument Spreadsheet: .ods, .ots
Character Separated Values: .csv, .tsv

File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.

remarks.note: Supported only if updating the whole page with a postback and not if doing partial-page updates (when you use UpdatePanel controls to update selected regions of a page).
remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse, HttpResponseBase or HttpResponseMessage because otherwise GemBox.Document assembly would have a dependency on System.Web or System.Net.Http assemblies and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
For supported file extensions, see remarks for method.

member.seealso: Export Excel file with ASP.NET

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.CsvAllowNewlineInQuotes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SaveCsv() methods will allow newline in quotes.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .
If this property is , newline in quoted value will be threated as part of that value. If this property is , newline in quoted value will be threated as the beginning of the new row.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.CsvAlwaysQuoteValues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SaveCsv() methods will always put values in quotes.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .

All values (including numbers) in CSV files are stored as text. If this property is , any of overloads will always put values in quotes. If this property is , only values that contain special characters (quotes or CSV separator) will be quoted.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.CsvParseNumbersDuringLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets whether LoadCsv() methods will try to convert text values to numbers.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .

All values (including numbers) in CSV files are stored as text. By default, any of overloads will try to parse text values as numbers and if successful cell will be filled with value. If you don't want such behavior (for example, you want IDs like "00935" to remain strings), set this property to .

member.name: E:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.IoWarning
member.summary: Fired for unexpected situations when reading or writing XLS / CSV files.

member.name: E:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.LimitNear
member.summary: Occurs when the size of XLS / CSV file in reading / writing is near GemBox.Spreadsheet free limit.

remarks.para: This event is fired when 80% of maximum row count per worksheet is reached (150 * 0.8 = 120 rows) or when 5 worksheets are used.
This event is not fired if event is fired.
You can use this event to detect when your application is close to GemBox.Spreadsheet free limit. For example, you can write number of used rows to a log file or send a notification e-mail.

member.name: E:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.LimitReached
member.summary: Occurs when the size of XLS / CSV file in reading / writing is above GemBox.Spreadsheet free limit.

remarks.para: This event is fired when maximum row count per worksheet is reached (150 rows) or when more than 5 worksheets are used.
You can use this event to notify a user of your application that data is only partially read / written.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the default font used in the workbook.
member.remarks: Default value for this property is "Calibri".

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.DefaultFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets default font size.

remarks.para: Unit is twip (1/20th of a point).
Default value of this property is 220.

member.name: P:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.RowColumnResolutionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution method.

remarks.para: Because of limitations of Microsoft Excel file format, every cell must be written to file with resolved . In the case where a cell doesn't have specific property set on its and that property is set on both row and column that contain that cell, a cell will inherit property value from row or column , depending on the resolution method.
Default value for this property is .

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFile.SaveToHttpResponse(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Saves the to a System.Web.HttpResponse output stream and sets appropriate HTTP response headers. Use this method in ASP.NET application to send the document to a client browser. File format is resolved from parameter or parameter file extension as described in remarks. See remarks why parameter is of type .
member.param: HttpResponse object that can be retrieved through the Response property of the System.Web.HttpApplication, System.Web.HttpContext, System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.UserControl classes.
File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
The saving options which can be used to define settings for save operation.

remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse because otherwise GemBox.Spreadsheet assembly would have a dependency on System.Web assembly and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
File format in which will be saved depends on the type of the first item in array as follows:

item.description: if array first item is of type , will be saved in Microsoft Excel 2007 format,
otherwise if array first item is of type or , will be saved in Character separated value format,
otherwise if array first item is of type , will be saved in HyperText Markup Language format,
otherwise, file format in which is saved is resolved based on parameter file extension.

remarks.para: Following file extensions are supported:

item.description: Microsoft Excel 2007 formats: .xlsx, .xlsm, .xltm, .xltx
Microsoft Excel 97-2003 formats: .xls, .xlt
Character separated value formats: .csv, .tsv
OpenDocument Spreadsheet formats: .ods, .ots
HyperText Markup Language formats: .htm, .html

member.name: M:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFilePage.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the workbook page to a file with the specified path. Path must include file extension.
member.param: The path to which to save the workbook page.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.
member.remarks:
File extension that is extracted from the is used to create the appropriate derived class instance that is then passed to the method.
Following file extensions are supported:
Portable Document Format: .pdf
XML Paper Specification: .xps
Image: .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .tif, .tiff, .wdp

member.name: T:GemBox.Spreadsheet.ExcelFillPattern
member.summary: Represents cell fill (background) formatting which can be either pattern or gradient.

remarks.para: Conceptually, cell formatting is divided into following groups:

item.description: Number - indicates how to format and render the numeric value of a cell. Associated property is .
Alignment - formatting information pertaining to text alignment in cells. Associated properties are , , , , , and .
Font - defines the properties for the used font. Associated property is .
Border - expresses a single set of cell border formats (left, right, top, bottom and diagonal). Associated property is .
Fill - specifies fill formatting (pattern or gradient). Associated property is .
Protection - contains protection properties associated with the cell. Associated properties are and .

remarks.para: Additional properties not associated with any formatting group are:

item.description: - name of the referenced workbook style.
- to store numeric value of a cell as text; otherwise, .
- if referenced workbook style is default () and there are no additional modifications of cell formatting; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Workbook contains a set of master styles which can be referenced by multiple cells.
Workbook must always contain at least one master style which cannot be removed and is, by default, referenced by all cells. This default style is .
Workbook style can either be built-in or user-defined. Built-in style is accessible from workbook styles via enumeration.

Cell formatting group (Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill or Protection) (and its associated properties) is resolved from referenced workbook (master) style, unless cell formatting group or its associated property is modified.

Cell formatting is available for one or more cells through property which is available on and types. Cell formatting specified on and types through property is simply propagated to cell formatting of its .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.

Default value is .
Currently supported only in XLS and XLSX. For all other formats it defaults to either or .

note.para: For performance reasons, cell formatting on is resolved based just on its top-left cell formatting, except borders which are resolved based on corner cells depending on border side.
Setting cell formatting property on is propagated to each cell in a range.

remarks.para: To set workbook (master) style to one or more cells, simply assign it to property.

note.para: Preferable way to modify formatting property of multiple cells is to get to which all those cells belong, and use property of that range to make the modification.

If modifying multiple formatting properties of a , without preserving unmodified formatting properties, preferable way is to create new instance of , make modifications on it, and assign it to property of that range.

remarks.para: GemBox.Spreadsheet internally takes care not to allocate unnecessary cells when formatting a range of cells (for example, when formatting all worksheet cells) and to cache formatting information of equally formatted cells, at the appropriate time, to reduce memory footprint.
